article:
'Jeff Sagarin' is an American sports statistician well known for his development
of a methodology for ranking and rating sports teams in a variety of sports. His
ratings have been a regular feature in the USA Today sports section since
1985, [http://www.usatoday.com/sports/sagarin.htm USA Today Jeff Sagarin's
page] have been used by the NCAA Tournament Selection Committee to help
determine the participants in the NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Championship
tournament since 1984, [http://www.bepress.com/jqas/vol4/iss2/8/ West, Brady
T. (2008) "A Simple and Flexible Rating Method for Predicting Success in the
NCAA Basketball Tournament: Updated Results from 2007," Journal of Quantitative
Analysis in Sports: Vol. 4 : Iss. 2, Article 8. (Sec. 2.2)] and have been
a part of the Bowl Championship Series since its inception in
1998. [http://www.bcsfootball.org/news/story?id=4819686 Official BCS
Website: Standings]
